commit_message:
Replace fakes.FakeClient inheritence with Mock

NovaFakeClient had fakes.FakeClient as a super classes.

This dependency broke the build as the interface was not
well defined

Replace the super classe FakeClient with MagicMock and implement
the local return types as mock object

Closes-bug: 1364515
Change-Id: I746daf38f985eba824a5a0759f450766b08b2dab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/34/119734/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import mock class NovaFakeClient(mock.MagicMock): super(NovaFakeClient, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.servers = mock.MagicMock() self.servers.list.return_value = self.get_server_list() self.flavors = mock.MagicMock() self.flavors.list.return_value = self.get_flavor_list() self.hosts = mock.MagicMock() self.hosts.list.return_value = self.get_host_list() def get_mock_server(self, id, name, host_id, status, tenant_id, user_id, flavor, image): #s.id, s.name, s.hostId, s.status, s.tenant_id, # s.user_id, image, flavor) server = mock.MagicMock() server.id = id server.hostId = host_id server.tenant_id = tenant_id server.user_id = user_id server.status = status server.name = name server.image = image server.flavor = flavor return server def get_server_list(self): server_one = \ self.get_mock_server(1234, 'sample-server', "e4d909c290d0fb1ca068ffaddf22cbd0", 'BUILD', '50e14867-7c64-4ec9-be8d-ed2470ca1d24', '33ea0494-2bdf-4382-a445-9068997430b9', {"id": 1}, {"id": 2}) server_two = \ self.get_mock_server(5678, 'sample-server2', "9e107d9d372bb6826bd81d3542a419d6", 'ACTIVE', '50e14867-7c64-4ec9-be8d-ed2470ca1d24', '33ea0494-2bdf-4382-a445-9068997430b9', {"id": 1}, {"id": 2}) server_three = \ self.get_mock_server(9012, 'sample-server3', "9e107d9d372bb6826bd81d3542a419d6", 'ACTIVE', '50e14867-7c64-4ec9-be8d-ed2470ca1d24', '33ea0494-2bdf-4382-a445-9068997430b9', {"id": 1}, {"id": 2}) return [server_one, server_two, server_three] def get_flavor(self, id, name, vcpus, ram, disk, ephemeral, rxtx_factor): f = mock.MagicMock() f.id = id f.name = name f.vcpus = vcpus f.ram = ram f.disk = disk f.ephemeral = ephemeral f.rxtx_factor = rxtx_factor return f def get_flavor_list(self): flavor_one = self.get_flavor(1, "256 MB Server", 1, 256, 10, 10, 1.0) flavor_two = self.get_flavor(2, "512 MB Server", 2, 512, 20, 20, 1.0) flavor_three = self.get_flavor(3, "128 MB Server", 4, 128, 0, 0, 3.0) flavor_four = self.get_flavor(4, "1024 MB Server", 3, 1024, 10, 10, 2.0) return [flavor_one, flavor_two, flavor_three, flavor_four] def get_host(self, host_name, service, zone): h = mock.MagicMock() h.host_name = host_name h.service = service h.zone = zone return h def get_host_list(self): h_one = self.get_host('host1', 'nova-compute', 'nova1') h_two = self.get_host('host2', 'nova-cert', 'nova1') return [h_one, h_two]

commit_message:
Shortened tablenames constants in Neutron driver

Previously, the constants for tablenames in the Neutron
driver were all prefixed with NEUTRON_, e.g.
NEUTRON_PORTS_SECURITY_GROUPS.  This prefix is unnecessary
since it is clear from context.

This change removes the prefix throughout the codebase.

Change-Id: Ib9cea8243886523ad639f7151ac593fc3ad21804

commit_message:
Fixed Neutron translation of external_gateway_info

Previously, the translation of the router's external_gateway_info
basically either returned True or False, indicating whether or
not the external_gateway_info was None or not.

This change properly translates external_gateway_info
into either None or a hash table.  It also adds tests
for router and security_group translations.

Change-Id: Ie482d57d6e644bffc9cf0f57a578f04a6e5fabbe

added_lines: NEUTRON_ROUTERS_EXTERNAL_GATEWAYS = "routers.external_gateways" # TODO(thinrichs): add 'routes' column # TODO(thinrichs): add 'rules' column d[cls.NEUTRON_ROUTERS_EXTERNAL_GATEWAYS] = ( 'external_gateway_info', 'key', 'value') self.state[self.NEUTRON_ROUTERS_EXTERNAL_GATEWAYS] = set() external_gateway_uuid = str(uuid.uuid4()) row[d[key]] = external_gateway_uuid for v_key, v_value in value.items(): v_key = self.value_to_congress(v_key) v_value = self.value_to_congress(v_value) eg_row = (external_gateway_uuid, v_key, v_value) self.state[ self.NEUTRON_ROUTERS_EXTERNAL_GATEWAYS].add( eg_row) LOG.debug("NEUTRON_EXTERNAL_GATEWAYS: %s", str(self.state[self.NEUTRON_ROUTERS_EXTERNAL_GATEWAYS]))

commit_message:
Added schema interface to datasource drivers

Previously, the Nova and Neutron datasource drivers had
different ways of exporting their schemas.

This change introduces an interface for exposing a schema.
The interface consists of one method, 'get_schema', which
returns a dictionary that maps each tablename to a tuple
of column names.

Change-Id: I21d6f5926560a2e720a4e8240381237bdacdfe70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/30/117930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """This method is called by d6cage to create a dataservice instance.""" def get_schema(cls): """Returns a dictionary mapping tablenames to the list of column names for that table. Both tablenames and columnnames are strings. """ d = {} d[cls.SERVERS] = ("id", "name", "host_id", "status", "tenant_id", "user_id", "image_id", "flavor_id") d[cls.FLAVORS] = ("id", "name", "vcpus", "ram", "disk", "ephemeral", "rxtx_factor") d[cls.HOSTS] = ("host_name", "service", "zone") d[cls.FLOATING_IPS] = ("floating_ip", "id", "ip", "host_id", "pool") return d
deleted_lines: """This method is called by d6cage to create a dataservice instance. There are a couple of parameters we found useful to add to that call, so we included them here instead of modifying d6cage (and all the d6cage.createservice calls). """ # TODO(thinrichs): figure out right way of returning # meta-data for tables. Nova and Neutron do this # differently right now. Would be nice # if _get_tuple_list obeyed the metadata by construction. def get_tuple_metadata(cls, type): if type == cls.SERVERS: return ("id", "name", "host_id", "status", "tenant_id", "user_id", "image_id", "flavor_id") elif type == cls.FLAVORS: return ("id", "name", "vcpus", "ram", "disk", "ephemeral", "rxtx_factor") elif type == cls.HOSTS: return ("host_name", "service", "zone") elif type == cls.FLOATING_IPS: return ("floating_ip", "id", "ip", "host_id", "pool") else: return ()

commit_message:
Cleaned up Neutron and Nova drivers

The old drivers were a bit hard for people to understand.

This change simplifies the drivers a bit and improves things like
variable naming.

Change-Id: Ie3f81b825af144cf4483c5cad82099658fe5dee9

subject: Enhance decorators in agent and automate creation of command_map
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-28 15:03:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/0801f48f4b2bcf5b471b5c12117cf7501b8cbfee', 'message': "Remove unnecessary argument injection in agent sync and async decorators.

sync_command and async_command in ironic_python_agent/extensions/base.py
are implemented so that they change decorated method signature,
which is really bad practice. Example:

@sync_command
def orig_method(self, **kw):
...

sync_command decorator returns lambda which has one additional
argument 'command_name'

def sync_command(func):
    def decorated(self, command_name, **kw):
         ...
         func(self, **kw)
         ...
    return decorated

Additional parameter 'command_name' is removed from decorated function in
both decorators and func.__name__ is used as an argument for
AsyncCommandResult instead. Every call of decorated functions is fixed,
BaseAgentExtension.execute is updated to not send this extra argument.

Change-Id: Iff0f495bc8d9c731892feb0f4759a7f10ee76328
Closes-Bug: #1314148

commit_message:
Enhance decorators in agent and automate creation of command_map

sync_command and async_command in ironic_python_agent/extensions/base.py
are implemented so that they change decorated method signature,
which is really bad practice. Example:

@sync_command
def orig_method(self, **kw):
...

sync_command decorator returns lambda which has one additional
argument 'command_name'

def sync_command(func):
    def decorated(self, command_name, **kw):
         ...
         func(self, **kw)
         ...
    return decorated

Additional parameter 'command_name' is moved from decorated function to
decorator signature in both decorators. Every call of decorated functions
is fixed, BaseAgentExtension.execute is updated to not send this extra
argument. BaseAgentExtension.__init__ automatically generates command_map
from decorated methods.

Change-Id: Iff0f495bc8d9c731892feb0f4759a7f10ee76328
Closes-Bug: 1314148

commit_message:
Configure enabled and disabled extensions in tempest

This patch adds support for configuring the api_extensions
option of the various feature-$service-(enabled|disabled)
sections in tempest's configuration file.

Please note that enabled extensions for the object storage
service are specified in tempest using the discoverable_apis
configuration options.

Partially-implements: Blueprint branchless-tempest-extensions

Change-Id: Ib64c0a474b153f42f3a4a427d86275c85f107997
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/23/116123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add 'details' property to VMwareDriverException

The details property of the VimFaultException is very important and we
loose this information when we convert VimFaultException to a specific
subclass of VMwareDriverException. This patch fix this by propagating
the details to VMwareDriverException.

Change-Id: I42a50b60fc74383a2c1d9b907125ff17795ce440

commit_message:
Add two new functions to manipulate with lists

Add list.skip(count) and list.take(count) functions to collect only
a part of original list.

Change-Id: Ic730713f0baad64385e37b36e378615482c7a75d
Closes-bug: #1362892
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/77/117677/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if isinstance(collection, types.ListType): return helpers.parallel_select(collection, composer) else: return helpers.parallel_select(collection(), composer)@yaql.context.EvalArg('collection', types.ListType) @yaql.context.EvalArg('start', int) @yaql.context.EvalArg('end', int) def _slice(collection, start, end): return collection[start:end] @yaql.context.EvalArg('collection', types.ListType) @yaql.context.EvalArg('count', int) def _take(collection, count): return collection[:count] context.register_function(_slice, 'slice') context.register_function(_take, 'take')

commit_message:
Skipping dashboard test to unblock gate

The error is only seen in the gate when run in parallel, to ease
contention on the gate, temporarily disabling until a proper
solution has been determined.

Related-Bug: #1345955
Change-Id: I3b61895e3f2b0d96488bef56dc0c6105a212d4dc

commit_message:
nova: support setting scheduler_host_manager

Adds support for setting scheduler_host_manager if
it is set via heat metadata. Previously this
value was hard coded based upon the use of
either Ironic or Nova baremetal.

The motivation here is to be able to use the new Ironic driver
location in the Nova tree.

Change-Id: Id4ca7f90cd85129727e65d0d09f274f3a00d4ebe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/33/119633/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {{#nova.scheduler_host_manager}} scheduler_host_manager = {{.}} {{/nova.scheduler_host_manager}} {{^nova.scheduler_host_manager}} # scheduler_host_manager isn't explicitly set so we set it accordingly{{#nova.baremetal}} scheduler_host_manager = nova.scheduler.baremetal_host_manager.BaremetalHostManager {{/nova.baremetal}} {{/nova.scheduler_host_manager}}

commit_message:
Use unlogged batches instead of atomic batches

MagnetoDB API doesn't require atomic batches
so we can improve performance by using unlogged batches

Implements: bp improve-batch-write-performance

Change-Id: I139358ad6424095243f36b7f2a619ed0243ecdfe

commit_message:
Add ceilometer volume and glance notifications ostf tests 

Added ceilometer volume measurements: volume, volume.size
Added ceilometer glance measurements: image, image.size, image.update,
image.upload, image.delete

Partially implements: blueprint ceilometer-ostf-notification-tests

Change-Id: Ie9f3a518bc5e24a4289220385a1e6e0ac0a41305
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ostf refs/changes/63/103063/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: cls.cinder_notifications = ['volume', 'volume.size', 'snapshot', 'snapshot.size'] def wait_nova_notifications(self, query): for sample in self.nova_notifications:

commit_message:
Add uefi boot mode support in IloVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy

The following functionality need to be added in iLO driver:
  - Add set_boot_mode function to iLO driver to switch between
    bios and uefi boot modes.
  - Validate boot_mode for IloVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy driver.

Change-Id: Ic8496a2d97aab6634b573c85d379b446c49e04b9
Implements: blueprint uefi-boot-for-ironic
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/61/116561/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ilo_common.validate_boot_mode(task.node) ilo_common.set_boot_mode(task.node, ilo_common.get_node_capability(task.node, 'boot_mode'))

subject: Don't write python bytecode while testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-12 12:33:34.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslotest/commit/5600749d89eaacfca63b3d8451e3c6e7fb76051b', 'message': "Don't write python bytecode while testing

This should reduce the number of times you need to do things like git
clean -x -i to kill pyc files in your local directory to get tests to
pass.
It doesn't appear to address pyc files in the .tox directories, and
attempts to address that seem to go in circles. Ideas welcomed.

Change-Id: Ib1e52753bc8c75741067c19ff234999f570762ed
Related-Bug: #1368661
"}]
commit_message:
Don't write python bytecode while testing

This should reduce the number of times you need to do things like git
clean -x -i to kill pyc files in your local directory to get tests to
pass.
It doesn't appear to address pyc files in the .tox directories, and
attempts to address that seem to go in circles. Ideas welcomed.

Change-Id: Ib1e52753bc8c75741067c19ff234999f570762ed
Related-Bug: #1368661
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslotest refs/changes/81/121081/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=true

commit_message:
Don't write python bytecode while testing

This should reduce the number of times you need to do things like git
clean -x -i to kill pyc files in your local directory to get tests to
pass.
It doesn't appear to address pyc files in the .tox directories, and
attempts to address that seem to go in circles. Ideas welcomed.

Change-Id: I9593414742a369d1922cc040eae9e8188200caac
Related-Bug: #1368661
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/84/121084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=true

commit_message:
Remove templates from toctrees

We don't want the templates to show up in the RSS feed, so exclude them
from being converted to HTML and listed in the toctree.

Change-Id: I67496730d1952ffdec92c5f78531508c55225ca6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/63/120463/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exclude_patterns = [ '_build', '**/*template.rst', ]

commit_message:
Add RSS feed

Publish an RSS feed of the changes to the specs repository to make the
specs more discoverable.

Change-Id: Ib4f84efab8b3af3ddd47d38d63a91362612bd655
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/62/120462/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'yasfb',# Feed configuration for yasfb feed_base_url = 'http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/barbican-specs/' feed_author = 'OpenStack Barbican Team'

Closes-bug: 1368100
"}]
commit_message:
Do not allow to create 5.0-based environments

5.0 releases don't have version suffix, so filter them out by
comparing release version to '2014.1'

Change-Id: I7a1c1e6148e145ba6e89e8d451e21b5de67a4662
Closes-bug: 1368100
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/25/121125/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return !release.get('version').match(/-5\.0[\.\d]*$/) && release.get('version') != '2014.1';

commit_message:
Adding /etc/ dir to location of edp-examples to reflect reality

Adding /etc/ dir to location of edp-examples since that is the
actual location where they wound-up.

Closes-Bug: #1368382
Change-Id: Ic503f07bc882f589619105df59a6a7cacf352207
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-extra refs/changes/69/120869/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The EDP examples have been moved to the **sahara** repo under *sahara/etc/edp-examples*
deleted_lines: The EDP examples have been moved to the **sahara** repo under *sahara/edp-examples*

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-12 13:27:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty/commit/fe312590eefaedf091d35fc2b73b77afe2459ecb', 'message': "Fixed regression with ZipFile handling

Flags got moved from a to a+ but it's unsupported by ZipFile.

Change-Id: I6ddf14c07e84af0a5e5b0994d72a8bfc506adce0
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-12 13:35:46.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/writer/osrf.py', 'cloudkitty/write_orchestrator.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty/commit/44e9d76403c07a814be612ac5c177570adc699cc', 'message': "Fixed regression in file writing

Flags got moved from a to a+ but it's unsupported by ZipFile.
Changed the name of the write_backend variable but forgot to change it

Change-Id: I6ddf14c07e84af0a5e5b0994d72a8bfc506adce0

commit_message:
Fixed regression in file writing

Flags got moved from a to a+ but it's unsupported by ZipFile.
Changed the name of the write_backend variable but forgot to change it
in the OSRF writer.

Change-Id: I6ddf14c07e84af0a5e5b0994d72a8bfc506adce0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/11/121111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._osrtf = zipfile.ZipFile(filename, 'a')

subject: Debug semaphore creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 17:49:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/beb6249f945248962012c977e219b613dc743836', 'message': "Debug semaphore creation

Just adds some debugging around when semaphores are created so we
can tell if they're being double-locked or just destroyed and
recreated.

Change-Id: Ia266fbdc87fcacdbc3eddcab83a3a39caff6c19c
"}]
commit_message:
Debug semaphore creation

Just adds some debugging around when semaphores are created so we
can tell if they're being double-locked or just destroyed and
recreated.

Change-Id: Ia266fbdc87fcacdbc3eddcab83a3a39caff6c19c

commit_message:
add oslo.utils for testing with Keystoneclient master

stable/* tests run with keystoneclient master and
master keystoneclient will be changing to require
oslo.utils.

Conflicts:

	test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ia29f69731d4dc79e8fc5d14afa932558de387799
Closes-Bug: #1357652
(cherry picked from commit 087550b02b63fdd6ffd5114829591f9b859853ac)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/46/114846/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add code/api documentation

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune
the indexes to remove references to code we would like to
hide like the common modules and private modules in conf.py.
We reuse the same excluded_patterns variable that is already
used in Sphinx and filter these modules from autoindex.rst

Change-Id: I4baea1efa227ef14bc6706d59ff3dcad93c2eacc
Closes-Bug: #1364140
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/33/118933/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: output_file = oslo.concurrency/locale/oslo.concurrency.pot [pbr] # NOTE(dims): uncomment ``warnerrors`` line, when setup.cfg we then # want to treat sphinx warnings as errors # warnerrors = True autodoc_index_modules = True

subject: Add API to enable calling module to register an exception
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-31 06:10:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware/commit/3ef0ab6901d9d26ec2154f798b8b9170cd3a48c8', 'message': 'Add API to enable calling module to extend the exception fault list

In certain cases the application, for example Nova, may need to treat
a VC exception that is currently not supported by oslo.vmware.

This will enable the application to dynamically add exceptions and then
remove them when oslo.vmware is updated to support the new exception.

commit_message:
Add API to enable calling module to register an exception

In certain cases the application, for example Nova, may need to treat
a VC exception that is currently not supported by oslo.vmware.

This will enable the application to dynamically add exceptions and then
remove them when oslo.vmware is updated to support the new exception.

The patch also fixes a typo with the exception fault handling.

Change-Id: I332a4ff2ac2c6d4e6ac88bbd067ef0d4e659ffa3

commit_message:
Implement short syntax for passing base-parameters into adhoc-action

Change-Id: I4682520138e5fdde86d02afed133d6dba8f867af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/41/121041/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonimport reCMD_PTRN = re.compile("^[\w\.]+[^=\s\"]*") PARAMS_PTRN = re.compile("([\w]+)=(\"[^=]*\"|\'[^=]*'|" "\{[^=]*\}|\[[^=]*\]|[\.,:\w\d\.]*)") @staticmethod def _parse_cmd_and_params(cmd_str): # TODO(rakhmerov): Try to find a way with one expression. cmd_matcher = CMD_PTRN.search(cmd_str) if not cmd_matcher: msg = "Invalid action/workflow task property: %s" % cmd_str raise exc.InvalidModelException(msg) cmd = cmd_matcher.group() params = {} for k, v in re.findall(PARAMS_PTRN, cmd_str): # Remove embracing quotes. if v[0] == '"' or v[0] == "'": v = v[1:-1] else: try: v = json.loads(v) except Exception: pass params[k] = v return cmd, params

commit_message:
Add mechanism for generation action parameters

 * Add getting human-readable params for adding
   to action
 * Add getting description for action
 * Parameters and description is already generated
   for std_actions
 * Unit tests

TODO:
  * Add the same for OpenStack Actions

Change-Id: I2f2a8ebe3bc3e75ab53f985adcecb59c0f1d7d8b

Add oslo.utils and oslo.serialization

the gate tests run against master.

subject: Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-21 18:00:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e910a420802574866b820a2c51a1d206b4ade68c', 'message': 'Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces

Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Change-Id: I7f59e2c1e757c28dae35c44ebfad9d764ae1d3c5
Closes-Bug: 1240849
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-12 13:22:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9357209e4b0de2c01e7d9495a2aa523780ca7009', 'message': 'Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces

an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I7f59e2c1e757c28dae35c44ebfad9d764ae1d3c5
Closes-Bug: 1240849
(cherry picked from commit 60cb0911712ad11688b4d09e5c01ac39c49f5aea)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces

Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I7f59e2c1e757c28dae35c44ebfad9d764ae1d3c5
Closes-Bug: 1240849
(cherry picked from commit 60cb0911712ad11688b4d09e5c01ac39c49f5aea)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/53/108453/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if updated_ports is None: updated_ports = set() updated_ports.update(self.check_changed_vlans(registered_ports)) def check_changed_vlans(self, registered_ports): """Return ports which have lost their vlan tag. The returned value is a set of port ids of the ports concerned by a vlan tag loss. """ port_tags = self.int_br.get_port_tag_dict() changed_ports = set() for lvm in self.local_vlan_map.values(): for port in registered_ports: if ( port in lvm.vif_ports and lvm.vif_ports[port].port_name in port_tags and port_tags[lvm.vif_ports[port].port_name] != lvm.vlan ): LOG.info( _("Port '%(port_name)s' has lost " "its vlan tag '%(vlan_tag)d'!"), {'port_name': lvm.vif_ports[port].port_name, 'vlan_tag': lvm.vlan} ) changed_ports.add(port) return changed_ports

commit_message:
Adds v2 keystone service test to service v3

This submission adds missing v3 tests in test_services.py
when compared with v2 test_services.py. Also added corresponding
support functions to service_client.py.

Change-Id: I73d44af9851cbfb33b490a313b1c2808c291840a

commit_message:
Add a NotLockingAccounts credentials provider

This credentials provider does not do any locking, so it
does not suffer from the lack of credentials cleanup which
affects the regular locking Accounts class.

Using thie credentials provider allows to keep it possible
to run tempest with no tenant isolation, and in serial mode,
as it is done today by one of periodic jobs.

Partially-implements bp:test-accounts
Change-Id: I160d183a299d2e46d269428409af680c0fdb03b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/35/118635/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class NotLockingAccounts(Accounts): """Credentials provider which always returns the first and second configured accounts as primary and alt users. This credential provider can be used in case of serial test execution to preserve the current behaviour of the serial tempest run. """ def get_creds(self, id): try: _hash = self.hash_dict.keys()[id] except IndexError: msg = 'Insufficient number of users provided' raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration(msg) return self.hash_dict[_hash] def get_primary_creds(self): if self.isolated_creds.get('primary'): return self.isolated_creds.get('primary') creds = self.get_creds(0) primary_credential = auth.get_credentials(**creds) self.isolated_creds['primary'] = primary_credential return primary_credential def get_alt_creds(self): if self.isolated_creds.get('alt'): return self.isolated_creds.get('alt') creds = self.get_creds(1) alt_credential = auth.get_credentials(**creds) self.isolated_creds['alt'] = alt_credential return alt_credential def clear_isolated_creds(self): self.isolated_creds = {} def get_admin_creds(self): return auth.get_default_credentials("identity_admin", fill_in=False)

commit_message:
Fix V2 hypervisor server schema attribute

Nova v2 hypervisor server API return attribute "uuid" in response's
server dict. Current response schema does not have this attribute instead
it contain "id" which is wrong.

This patch fix the above issue.

NOTE- "uuid" attribute in this API response is always a uuid.

Change-Id: I78c67834de930012b70874938f345524d69264ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/36/118936/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'uuid': {'type': 'string'},
deleted_lines: # NOTE: Now the type of 'id' is integer, # but here allows 'string' also because we # will be able to change it to 'uuid' in # the future. 'id': {'type': ['integer', 'string']},

commit_message:
Fix sample-create in v2 api calls

A dict embedded in a list is the expected input. In
47934c777c50897b649793e0960eebdaad322c45 the list was lost, this
puts it back.

Note that the _exact_ date of this failure was identified by
existing Rally jobs which started failing in early August. That made
searching the commit logs straightforward.

Change-Id: I37e794de7a23b8ce8e67a086732af5a19f182409
Closes-Bug: #1367867

commit_message:
Allow some translations to be made.

Transform some action_present and action_past variables from attributes to
methods with the solution proposed in this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91338/
Also fix a bug in the solution above where the __init__ function in the
deleteAction class overwrite the action_present and action_past methods.
Closes-Bug: 1366731

Change-Id: I9595f9d5a5a3f1ef4d528ddb3e08737a43471402
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/48/119748/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils.translation import ungettext_lazy @staticmethod def action_present(count): return ungettext_lazy( u"Delete key pair", u"Delete key pairs", count ) @staticmethod def action_past(count): return ungettext_lazy( u"Key pair deleted", u"Key pairs deleted", count )

subject: Make strutils.mask_password more secure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-09 21:15:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/635a323a531144a8b9e582498bf45824d080c912', 'message': 'Make strutils.mask_password more secure

Make some enhancements to strutils.mask_password to allow it to
catch more cases of passwords in strings.

The following is a listing of patterns that will be handled. The
keyword that mask_password uses (a list of four now) is represented
by <key> and the password is shown as <password>. Quotes (both single
and double) are represented as <quote>.

--<key> <password>
--<key> <quote><password><quote>
<key> = <password>
<key> = <quote><password><quote>

All existing tests and patterns are still handled.

commit_message:
Make strutils.mask_password more secure

Make some enhancements to strutils.mask_password to allow it to
catch more cases of passwords in strings.

The following is a listing of patterns that will be handled. The
keyword that mask_password uses (a list of four now) is represented
by <key> and the password is shown as <password>. Quotes (both single
and double) are represented as <quote>.

--<key> <password>
--<key> <quote><password><quote>
<key> = <password>
<key> = <quote><password><quote>

All existing tests and patterns are still handled.

Cherry-pick from 61d5de69850bf082b2aa45747104b2b5be764c21
Partial-Bug: #1345233

Conflicts:
	nova/openstack/common/strutils.py

Change-Id: I693baaf225c5b393401d499d14f271cadb63eb2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/120231/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(flaper87): The following globals are used by `mask_password` _SANITIZE_KEYS = ['adminPass', 'admin_pass', 'password', 'admin_password'] # NOTE(ldbragst): Let's build a list of regex objects using the list of # _SANITIZE_KEYS we already have. This way, we only have to add the new key # to the list of _SANITIZE_KEYS and we can generate regular expressions # for XML and JSON automatically. _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_2 = [] _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_1 = [] # NOTE(amrith): Some regular expressions have only one parameter, some # have two parameters. Use different lists of patterns here. _FORMAT_PATTERNS_1 = [r'(%(key)s\s*[=]\s*)[^\s^\'^\"]+'] _FORMAT_PATTERNS_2 = [r'(%(key)s\s*[=]\s*[\"\']).*?([\"\'])', r'(%(key)s\s+[\"\']).*?([\"\'])', r'([-]{2}%(key)s\s+)[^\'^\"^=^\s]+([\s]*)', r'(<%(key)s>).*?(</%(key)s>)', r'([\"\']%(key)s[\"\']\s*:\s*[\"\']).*?([\"\'])', r'([\'"].*?%(key)s[\'"]\s*:\s*u?[\'"]).*?([\'"])', r'([\'"].*?%(key)s[\'"]\s*,\s*\'--?[A-z]+\'\s*,\s*u?' '[\'"]).*?([\'"])', r'(%(key)s\s*--?[A-z]+\s*)\S+(\s*)'] for key in _SANITIZE_KEYS: for pattern in _FORMAT_PATTERNS_2: reg_ex = re.compile(pattern % {'key': key}, re.DOTALL) _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_2.append(reg_ex) for pattern in _FORMAT_PATTERNS_1: reg_ex = re.compile(pattern % {'key': key}, re.DOTALL) _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_1.append(reg_ex) def mask_password(message, secret="***"): """Replace password with 'secret' in message. :param message: The string which includes security information. :param secret: value with which to replace passwords. :returns: The unicode value of message with the password fields masked. For example: >>> mask_password("'adminPass' : 'aaaaa'") "'adminPass' : '***'" >>> mask_password("'admin_pass' : 'aaaaa'") "'admin_pass' : '***'" >>> mask_password('"password" : "aaaaa"') '"password" : "***"' >>> mask_password("'original_password' : 'aaaaa'") "'original_password' : '***'" >>> mask_password("u'original_password' : u'aaaaa'") "u'original_password' : u'***'" """ message = six.text_type(message) # NOTE(ldbragst): Check to see if anything in message contains any key # specified in _SANITIZE_KEYS, if not then just return the message since # we don't have to mask any passwords. if not any(key in message for key in _SANITIZE_KEYS): return message substitute = r'\g<1>' + secret + r'\g<2>' for pattern in _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_2: message = re.sub(pattern, substitute, message) substitute = r'\g<1>' + secret for pattern in _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_1: message = re.sub(pattern, substitute, message) return message

commit_message:
Initial kerberos plugin implementation.

This patch will allow to use kerberos credentials to retrieve
a token during a post on /v3/auth/tokens. It will force the negotiate
communication with the client if the method specified is kerberos
and leaves unaffected the other plugins.

bp: kerberos-authentication

Change-Id: I2fad67c3613c273187f6ca32985d360352c81bf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/17/74317/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2012 OpenStack LLC # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import kerberos import os import webob from keystone.common import wsgi from keystone.auth import controllers as auth_v3_controllers from keystone.token import provider from keystone.openstack.common import jsonutils from keystone.openstack.common import log LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) # Environment variable used to pass the request context CONTEXT_ENV = wsgi.CONTEXT_ENV class KerberosAuthV3Middleware(wsgi.Middleware): token_provider = provider.Manager() def __init__(self, app, hostname, keytab): super(KerberosAuthV3Middleware, self).__init__(app) self.service = 'HTTP@%s' % hostname os.environ['KRB5_KTNAME'] = keytab try: principal = kerberos.getServerPrincipalDetails('HTTP', hostname) except kerberos.KrbError as exc: LOG.warn('KerberosAuthV3Middleware: %s' % exc.message[0]) else: LOG.debug('KerberosAuthV3Middleware is identifying as %s' % principal) def create_token(self, context, username, auth): context['REMOTE_USER'] = username context['query_string'] = 'nocatalog' return auth_v3_controllers.Auth().authenticate_for_token(context, auth) def authenticate(self, client_token): state = None server_token = None user = None try: rc, state = kerberos.authGSSServerInit(self.service) if rc == kerberos.AUTH_GSS_COMPLETE: rc = kerberos.authGSSServerStep(state, client_token) if rc == kerberos.AUTH_GSS_COMPLETE: server_token = kerberos.authGSSServerResponse(state) user = kerberos.authGSSServerUserName(state) elif rc == kerberos.AUTH_GSS_CONTINUE: server_token = kerberos.authGSSServerResponse(state) except kerberos.GSSError: pass finally: if state: kerberos.authGSSServerClean(state) return server_token, user def unauthorized_response(self, token=None): response = webob.Response() response.status_code = 401 if token: response.headers['WWW-Authenticate'] = token else: response.headers['WWW-Authenticate'] = 'Negotiate' return response def forbidden_response(self): response = webob.Response() response.status_code = 403 return response def process_request(self, request): auth_body = jsonutils.loads(request.body)['auth'] if 'kerberos' in auth_body['identity']['methods']: context = request.environ.get(CONTEXT_ENV, {}) response = None authHeader = request.environ.get('HTTP_AUTHORIZATION') if authHeader is None: return self.unauthorized_response() client_token = ''.join(authHeader.split()[1:]) server_token, user = self.authenticate(client_token) if user: auth_body['identity']['methods'] = [ m for m in auth_body['identity']['methods'] if m != 'kerberos'] response = self.create_token(context, user, auth_body) response.headers['WWW-Authenticate'] = server_token return response elif server_token: return self.unauthorized_response(server_token) else: return self.forbidden_response()

commit_message:
Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.execute(), the
exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception.

Cherry-pick from 853d8f9897f8563851441108a9be26b10908c076
Partial-Bug: #1343604

Conflicts:
	nova/openstack/common/processutils.py

Change-Id: I9741dcdebdb4bed295ddc5ec4c4b117fffcfe88c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/120234/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.openstack.common import strutils sanitized_cmd = strutils.mask_password(' '.join(cmd)) LOG.log(loglevel, _('Running cmd (subprocess): %s'), sanitized_cmd) LOG.log(loglevel, 'Result was %s' % _returncode) if not ignore_exit_code and _returncode not in check_exit_code: (stdout, stderr) = result sanitized_stdout = strutils.mask_password(stdout) sanitized_stderr = strutils.mask_password(stderr) raise ProcessExecutionError(exit_code=_returncode, stdout=sanitized_stdout, stderr=sanitized_stderr, cmd=sanitized_cmd) LOG.log(loglevel, _('%r failed. Retrying.'), sanitized_cmd)
deleted_lines: LOG.log(loglevel, _('Running cmd (subprocess): %s'), ' '.join(cmd)) if _returncode: LOG.log(loglevel, _('Result was %s') % _returncode) if not ignore_exit_code and _returncode not in check_exit_code: (stdout, stderr) = result raise ProcessExecutionError(exit_code=_returncode, stdout=stdout, stderr=stderr, cmd=' '.join(cmd)) LOG.log(loglevel, _('%r failed. Retrying.'), cmd)

commit_message:
Sync latest processutils from oslo-incubator

This sync is primarily being done to pull in commit
63c99a0f so that passwords are masked in exception and
error messages.

------------------------------------------------

oslo-incubator head:

commit 80a08a413fb0f23a056eca2d273b167f0a09bab6
Merge: 83c4098 d73f3b1
Author: Jenkins <jenkins@review.openstack.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 25 14:32:36 2014 +0000

    Merge "Remove unused/mutable default args"

-----------------------------------------------

The sync pulls in the following changes (newest to oldest):

63c99a0f - Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages
e184dd36 - Fix exception message in openstack.common.processutils.execute
d6b55fb2 - Remove `processutils` dependency on `log`

-----------------------------------------------

Cherry-pick from ff0f112bb41fa0f01692f6c4eb8a20d9a4fa8a7c
Partial-bug: 1343604

Conflicts:
	cinder/openstack/common/processutils.py

Change-Id: Ia92aab76fa83d01c5fbf6f9d31df2463fc26ba5c

added_lines: import errno import logging import multiprocessingfrom cinder.openstack.common import strutils :param loglevel: log level for execute commands. :type loglevel: int. (Should be logging.DEBUG or logging.INFO) loglevel = kwargs.pop('loglevel', logging.DEBUG) raise UnknownArgumentError(_('Got unknown keyword args: %r') % kwargs) sanitized_cmd = strutils.mask_password(' '.join(cmd)) LOG.log(loglevel, _('Running cmd (subprocess): %s'), sanitized_cmd) LOG.log(loglevel, 'Result was %s' % _returncode) if not ignore_exit_code and _returncode not in check_exit_code: (stdout, stderr) = result sanitized_stdout = strutils.mask_password(stdout) sanitized_stderr = strutils.mask_password(stderr) raise ProcessExecutionError(exit_code=_returncode, stdout=sanitized_stdout, stderr=sanitized_stderr, cmd=sanitized_cmd) LOG.log(loglevel, _('%r failed. Retrying.'), sanitized_cmd)
deleted_lines: from cinder.openstack.common import log as logging raise UnknownArgumentError(_('Got unknown keyword args ' 'to utils.execute: %r') % kwargs) LOG.debug(_('Running cmd (subprocess): %s'), ' '.join(cmd)) if _returncode: LOG.debug(_('Result was %s') % _returncode) if not ignore_exit_code and _returncode not in check_exit_code: (stdout, stderr) = result raise ProcessExecutionError(exit_code=_returncode, stdout=stdout, stderr=stderr, cmd=' '.join(cmd)) LOG.debug(_('%r failed. Retrying.'), cmd)

commit_message:
Sync latest strutils from oslo-incubator

We have had a request from Tristan Cacqueray to pull in the latest
strutils.  The request is driven by a need to get improvements in
place that make strutils.mask_password more secure.

-------------------------------------

Head of oslo-incubator:
commit 80a08a413fb0f23a056eca2d273b167f0a09bab6
Merge: 83c4098 d73f3b1
Author: Jenkins <jenkins@review.openstack.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 25 14:32:36 2014 +0000

    Merge "Remove unused/mutable default args"

--------------------------------------

This sync pulls in the following change:

66142c34 - Make strutils.mask_password more secure

--------------------------------------

Cherry-pick from 30c9507a5540722f0cc7f828b57a93b44d6d1fcc
Partial-bug: 1345233

Conflicts:
	cinder/openstack/common/strutils.py

Change-Id: Ie51d316a30bed40996db6cd860dbb9cb173e5ac6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/22/120222/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(flaper87): The following globals are used by `mask_password` _SANITIZE_KEYS = ['adminPass', 'admin_pass', 'password', 'admin_password'] # NOTE(ldbragst): Let's build a list of regex objects using the list of # _SANITIZE_KEYS we already have. This way, we only have to add the new key # to the list of _SANITIZE_KEYS and we can generate regular expressions # for XML and JSON automatically. _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_2 = [] _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_1 = [] # NOTE(amrith): Some regular expressions have only one parameter, some # have two parameters. Use different lists of patterns here. _FORMAT_PATTERNS_1 = [r'(%(key)s\s*[=]\s*)[^\s^\'^\"]+'] _FORMAT_PATTERNS_2 = [r'(%(key)s\s*[=]\s*[\"\']).*?([\"\'])', r'(%(key)s\s+[\"\']).*?([\"\'])', r'([-]{2}%(key)s\s+)[^\'^\"^=^\s]+([\s]*)', r'(<%(key)s>).*?(</%(key)s>)', r'([\"\']%(key)s[\"\']\s*:\s*[\"\']).*?([\"\'])', r'([\'"].*?%(key)s[\'"]\s*:\s*u?[\'"]).*?([\'"])', r'([\'"].*?%(key)s[\'"]\s*,\s*\'--?[A-z]+\'\s*,\s*u?' '[\'"]).*?([\'"])', r'(%(key)s\s*--?[A-z]+\s*)\S+(\s*)'] for key in _SANITIZE_KEYS: for pattern in _FORMAT_PATTERNS_2: reg_ex = re.compile(pattern % {'key': key}, re.DOTALL) _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_2.append(reg_ex) for pattern in _FORMAT_PATTERNS_1: reg_ex = re.compile(pattern % {'key': key}, re.DOTALL) _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_1.append(reg_ex) def mask_password(message, secret="***"): """Replace password with 'secret' in message. :param message: The string which includes security information. :param secret: value with which to replace passwords. :returns: The unicode value of message with the password fields masked. For example: >>> mask_password("'adminPass' : 'aaaaa'") "'adminPass' : '***'" >>> mask_password("'admin_pass' : 'aaaaa'") "'admin_pass' : '***'" >>> mask_password('"password" : "aaaaa"') '"password" : "***"' >>> mask_password("'original_password' : 'aaaaa'") "'original_password' : '***'" >>> mask_password("u'original_password' : u'aaaaa'") "u'original_password' : u'***'" """ message = six.text_type(message) # NOTE(ldbragst): Check to see if anything in message contains any key # specified in _SANITIZE_KEYS, if not then just return the message since # we don't have to mask any passwords. if not any(key in message for key in _SANITIZE_KEYS): return message substitute = r'\g<1>' + secret + r'\g<2>' for pattern in _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_2: message = re.sub(pattern, substitute, message) substitute = r'\g<1>' + secret for pattern in _SANITIZE_PATTERNS_1: message = re.sub(pattern, substitute, message) return message

subject: Allow translators to translate BatchActions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-30 11:54:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/cdfcd1de8457b316ef90d2601ab2088f223ecad5', 'message': "Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Curently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.

This patch introduces the action_present_singular, action_present_plural,
action_past_singular and action_past_plural attributes which in conjonction
with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows better translation to be
performed

This patch also uses conextual markers in the translation which provide the
translators a context string allowing them to know in which context the
translation will take place.

We can't introduce contextual markers everywhere at once because Translators
would totaly loose their previous work. So we have to progressively introduce
contextual markers, when a string is changed, or for new strings. It is also
the reason why this patch changes only the string of the visible buttons.

Since we can't use contextual markers for all the code at once, this patch
partialy Closes-Bug: #1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-05-02 16:29:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/3e96b5773ae7dc9f2ea98db07ad565e047d490a9', 'message': "Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Curently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.

This patch introduces the action_present_singular, action_present_plural,
action_past_singular and action_past_plural attributes which in conjonction
with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows better translation to be
performed

This patch also uses conextual markers in the translation which provide the
translators a context string allowing them to know in which context the
translation will take place.
It is important to use unicode strings whith contextual markers because of the
following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22565

We can't introduce contextual markers everywhere at once because Translators
would totaly loose their previous work. So we have to progressively introduce
contextual markers, when a string is changed, or for new strings. It is also
the reason why this patch changes only the string of the visible buttons.

The _get_action_name now uses ngettext to handle plurals because they are
handled differently in diferent languages.
We use ngettext instead of ngettext_lazy because of the following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22566

Since we can't use contextual markers for all the code at once, this patch
partialy:

Closes-Bug: #1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-05-05 13:24:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/e73b42d497518557100de118eaff20c36c2262a5', 'message': "Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Currently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.

This patch introduces the action_present_singular, action_present_plural,
action_past_singular and action_past_plural attributes which in conjonction
with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows better translation to be
performed

This patch also uses contextual markers in the translation which provide the
translators a context string allowing them to know in which context the
translation will take place.
It is important to use unicode strings with contextual markers because of the
following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22565
The django community was very quick and responsive and fixed the bug very fast:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/142c27218a0bb07bb197faab7b1d8eb3a084f5b9
and back-ported their fix in the 1.6 and 1.7 django branches:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/61fd00d4fd65f44d0a05be4c7e95124e4102ec27
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/034866204b39f797c73997b03cd90443aa03aa91
but since in horizon we support back to django 1.4, we will have to live with
it by providing unicode strings until we drop support of old django versions.

We can't introduce contextual markers everywhere at once because Translators
would totally loose their previous work. So we have to progressively introduce
contextual markers, when a string is changed, or for new strings. It is also
the reason why this patch changes only the string of the visible buttons.

Since we can't use contextual markers for all the code at once, this patch
partially:

Closes-Bug: #1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2014-05-20 10:09:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/978f319c5bc54eaec18fcc75b8181ff3c2cf29e4', 'message': "Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Currently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural string.

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.
Indeed, some languages have up to 5 plural forms depending on the number of
items.

This patch introduces the fact that action_present is a method instead of an
attribute, which in conjonction with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows
better translation to be performed.

It is important to use unicode strings with contextual markers because of the
following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22565
The django community was very quick and responsive and fixed the bug very fast:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/142c27218a0bb07bb197faab7b1d8eb3a084f5b9
and back-ported their fix in the 1.6 and 1.7 django branches:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/61fd00d4fd65f44d0a05be4c7e95124e4102ec27
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/034866204b39f797c73997b03cd90443aa03aa91
but since in horizon we support back to django 1.4, we will have to live with
it by providing unicode strings until we drop support of old django versions.

We can't introduce contextual markers and ungettext (pluralization) verywhere
at once because Translators would totally loose their previous work. So we have
to progressively introduce contextual markers and pluralization, when a string
is changed, or for new strings. It is also the reason why this patch changes
only the string of the visible buttons.

Since we can't use contextual markers and pluralization for all the code at
once, this patch partially:

Closes-Bug: #1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716
"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2014-05-20 12:26:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6372e20632f1a91eac4f1e3344c31e3e09377407', 'message': "Allow translators to translate BatchActions

"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2014-05-20 15:11:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/2b3e0238c28d4b15340df58a952cc58c44d3e91d', 'message': "Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Currently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural string.

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.
Indeed, some languages have up to 5 plural forms depending on the number of
items.

This patch introduces the fact that action_present is a method instead of an
attribute, which in conjonction with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows
better translation to be performed.

It is important to use unicode strings with contextual markers because of the
following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22565
The django community was very quick and responsive and fixed the bug very fast:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/142c27218a0bb07bb197faab7b1d8eb3a084f5b9
and back-ported their fix in the 1.6 and 1.7 django branches:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/61fd00d4fd65f44d0a05be4c7e95124e4102ec27
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/034866204b39f797c73997b03cd90443aa03aa91
but since in horizon we support back to django 1.4, we will have to live with
it by providing unicode strings until we drop support of old django versions.

We can't introduce contextual markers and ungettext (pluralization) verywhere
at once because Translators would totally loose their previous work. So we have
to progressively introduce contextual markers and pluralization, when a string
is changed, or for new strings. It is also the reason why this patch changes
only the string of the visible buttons.

Since we can't use contextual markers and pluralization for all the code at
once, this patch partially:

Closes-Bug: #1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716
"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2014-05-21 17:32:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/347cf27fea4fdbaf148dd9cf95ef12f450187709', 'message': "Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Currently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural string.

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.
Indeed, some languages have up to 5 plural forms depending on the number of
items.

This patch introduces the fact that action_present is a method instead of an
attribute, which in conjonction with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows
better translation to be performed.

It is important to use unicode strings with contextual markers because of the
following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22565
The django community was very quick and responsive and fixed the bug very fast:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/142c27218a0bb07bb197faab7b1d8eb3a084f5b9
and back-ported their fix in the 1.6 and 1.7 django branches:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/61fd00d4fd65f44d0a05be4c7e95124e4102ec27
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/034866204b39f797c73997b03cd90443aa03aa91
but since in horizon we support back to django 1.4, we will have to live with
it by providing unicode strings until we drop support of old django versions.

We can't introduce contextual markers and ungettext (pluralization) verywhere
at once because Translators would totally loose their previous work. So we have
to progressively introduce contextual markers and pluralization, when a string
is changed, or for new strings. It is also the reason why this patch changes
only the string of the visible buttons.

Since we can't use contextual markers and pluralization for all the code at
once, this patch partially:

Closes-Bug: #1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716
"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2014-05-22 17:17:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/95abe6f9ea7b66ac4856105b0da3ab4c3c9a6de3', 'message': 'Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Currently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural string.

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.
Indeed, some languages have up to 5 plural forms depending on the number of
items.

This patch introduces the fact that action_present is a method instead of an
attribute, which in conjonction with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows
better translation to be performed.

This patch also adds contextual mrkers to STATUS_DISPLAY_CHOICES,
TASK_DISPLAY_CHOICES and POWER_DISPLAY_CHOICES because it was impossible to
translate the stand-alone words out of context for a translator (i.e. the word
"active" will be translated differently if the active object is feminine or
masculine, since feminine and masculine depends also on the language, it is
mission impossible for the translator to translate "active" if he does not know
"what" is "active").

It is important to use unicode strings with contextual markers because of the
following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22565
The django community was very quick and responsive and fixed the bug very fast:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/142c27218a0bb07bb197faab7b1d8eb3a084f5b9
and back-ported their fix in the 1.6 and 1.7 django branches:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/61fd00d4fd65f44d0a05be4c7e95124e4102ec27
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/034866204b39f797c73997b03cd90443aa03aa91
but since in horizon we support back to django 1.4, we will have to live with
it by providing unicode strings until we drop support of old django versions.

We can't introduce contextual markers and ungettext (pluralization) verywhere
at once because Translators would totally loose their previous work. So we have
to progressively introduce contextual markers and pluralization, when a string
is changed, or for new strings. It is also the reason why this patch changes
only the strings of the instance view actions.

This patch also fixes an issue where the status_class of a cell was set
depending on the post_translation of the cell status, therefore, in any
language other than english cells where in "status_unknown".

Since we can't use contextual markers and pluralization for all the code at
once, this patch partially:

Closes-Bug: #1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716

commit_message:
Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Currently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural string.

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.
Indeed, some languages have up to 5 plural forms depending on the number of
items.

This patch introduces the fact that action_present is a method instead of an
attribute, which in conjonction with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows
better translation to be performed.

This patch also adds contextual mrkers to STATUS_DISPLAY_CHOICES,
TASK_DISPLAY_CHOICES and POWER_DISPLAY_CHOICES because it was impossible to
translate the stand-alone words out of context for a translator (i.e. the word
"active" will be translated differently if the active object is feminine or
masculine, since feminine and masculine depends also on the language, it is
mission impossible for the translator to translate "active" if he does not know
"what" is "active").

It is important to use unicode strings with contextual markers because of the
following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22565
The django community was very quick and responsive and fixed the bug very fast:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/142c27218a0bb07bb197faab7b1d8eb3a084f5b9
and back-ported their fix in the 1.6 and 1.7 django branches:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/61fd00d4fd65f44d0a05be4c7e95124e4102ec27
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/034866204b39f797c73997b03cd90443aa03aa91
but since in horizon we support back to django 1.4, we will have to live with
it by providing unicode strings until we drop support of old django versions.

We can't introduce contextual markers and ungettext (pluralization) verywhere
at once because Translators would totally loose their previous work. So we have
to progressively introduce contextual markers and pluralization, when a string
is changed, or for new strings. It is also the reason why this patch changes
only the strings of the instance view actions.

Since we can't use contextual markers and pluralization for all the code at
once, this patch partially:

partial-bug: 1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/38/91338/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils.translation import pgettext_lazy action_present_singular = pgettext_lazy( "Terminate an Instance", u"Terminate %(data_type)s") action_present_plural = pgettext_lazy( "Terminate multiple Instances", u"Terminate %(data_type)s") data_type_singular = pgettext_lazy("A single Instance", u"Instance") data_type_plural = pgettext_lazy("Multiple Instances", u"Instances") action_present_singular = pgettext_lazy( "Action to perform on an Instance", u"Start %(data_type)s") action_present_plural = pgettext_lazy( "Action to perform on multiple Instances", u"Start %(data_type)s") action_past_singular = pgettext_lazy( "Status of an Instance", u"Started %(data_type)s") action_past_plural = pgettext_lazy( "Status of multiple Instances", u"Started %(data_type)s") data_type_singular = pgettext_lazy("A single Instance", u"Instance") data_type_plural = pgettext_lazy("Multiple Instances", u"Instances")
deleted_lines: action_present = _("Terminate") data_type_singular = _("Instance") data_type_plural = _("Instances") action_present = _("Start") action_past = _("Started") data_type_singular = _("Instance") data_type_plural = _("Instances")

commit_message:
Fix IPv6 default masks for SLAAC

IETF doesn't recommend use of IPv6 networks
with masks not "/64". Recommended subnetting is
3-1-4 - 48 for provider, 16 for subnetting and
64 for network. For example SLAAC will not
work if you use subnets different from /64.
Test with port update will not work until
bug 1364166 is fixed, added attribute to it.

Change-Id: I260c820dbde1f98b569e564c7b5e7e558e431c0d

commit_message:
Allow to pass dict from resource discovery

Allowing to pass dict from resource discovery and storing it
as metadata. Before it was only possible to pass IP address,
which is not enough.
For TripleO case, important metadata like image name and flavor
from Nova are passed and stored in resource, allowing to make
aggregate queries according to them.

Change-Id: I4dabf79f248842398e1126d310d110b1fe95fad5
Closes-Bug: #1366871

commit_message:
Update node details during node registration

If register-nodes is run a second time with the same set of nodes,
it will blindly try and re-register them, leading to failures from
the Nova or Ironic API. Instead, we now look for identifying marks
of registered nodes, and then update those nodes.

At the end, we check to see if there are any extra nodes registered,
and warn, possibly cleaning them up.

Change-Id: I8652c25077246626810f186259adbf14764f4571

commit_message:
Hiding "Launch as Instance" if volume is not bootable.

If a volume which is not bootable, is used to create an instance
then the instance will go into 'Error' state.
The patch solves this issue by hiding the 'Launch as Instance'
button if the volume is not bootable.

Closes-Bug: #1327310

Change-Id: I3d9e7edf846fafab4e735d562c1ec72ad32fb220

commit_message:
Looks for variable subtitution in the same group

When we do a variable subtitution we must try to look if the option
is avialable into the same group and then into the default one for backward
compatibilty.

Otherwise variable subtitution doesn't works when we change the group of
an option and deprecated the DEFAULT group.

Change-Id: Ie5750ee028a58fba6da225a8c4b4221e23db829f
Closes-bug: #1367790

commit_message:
CLI support for queue existence and metadata operations

This patch extends the queues operation supported by the CLI.
It also renames some of the previously added features to make
them more consistent with their behaviour.

Features added:
- Check queue existence
- Set queue metadata
- Get queue metadata
- Get queue stats

Some examples:
	$ openstack queue exists myqueue
	$ openstack queue set metadata myqueue
	$ openstack queue stats myqueue

The above assumes Keystone is installed and has an endpoint
configured for Marconi. In order to bypass this in a non-Keystone
based deployment, the user can pass Marconi's url manually:

    $  openstack --os-token test
                 --os-url http://127.0.0.1:8888
		 queue exists myqueue

Change-Id: I2d8d793037470a629e52e329a17a6fed04314c3d
Partially-Implements: blueprint cli

commit_message:
Move OpenStack update timeout to the settings.py

Make update timeout setting configurable via exporting
environment variable, so it could be tuned for different
deployment scenarios. Also increase timeout value to 1 hour
by default.

commit_message:
Move OpenStack update timeout to the settings.py

Make update timeout setting configurable via exporting
environment variable, so it could be tuned for different
deployment scenarios. Also increase timeout value to 1 hour
by default.

Change-Id: I110d9bf1b6c8dd68d38ffc76c0185c55eee87298

added_lines: UPDATE_TIMEOUT = os.environ.get('UPDATE_TIMEOUT', 3600)

commit_message:
Wait until Nailgun's API is ready after VM reset

After resetting Fuel master node we wait until 8000/tcp
port (nginx) is accepting connections. We also should wait
up to 2 minutes until Nailgun's API is ready.

Change-Id: I2360e0dab68ae0a20618f1da64ee5d6b4499e126
Closes-bug: #1368537

commit_message:
Use immutable arg rather mutable arg

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, then use 'arg = arg or []'.

Change-Id: Ie036e8203deb9ab10ffb7bce1db6cda6c3672a0c

commit_message:
Do not incur the cost of a second method call

The usage of dict.get here is unnecessary since dict.setdefault will
not override an existing value.

commit_message:
Don't start keepalived service until required configuration is available

When keepalived starts with invalid config file (e.g. interface to bind to
is not set), then keepalived process generates thousands error messages into
log file and then fails anyway.

Change-Id: I1518147ce9bacedad0b735be5ec2634f9c2670ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/40/120740/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: os-svc-enable -n keepalived INTERFACES=$(os-apply-config --key virtual_interfaces.instances --type raw --key-default '') if [ -z "$INTERFACES" ] ; then echo "No virtual interfaces to use" exit 1 fi

subject: Destroy pre existing VM's regardless of Provisioner
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 19:21:51.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/boot-seed-vm'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/714b279122ffbef28220448afcdfd88ace6594f5', 'message': "Destroy pre existing VM's regardless of Provisioner

Ironic doesn't require these to be shutdown but leaving them running
leads to nodes running in CI from previous tests hitting the API of

are confusing when debugging problems.

Change-Id: Ia5bccd69af0f92c14db901f09b32521821ba567d
"}]
commit_message:
Destroy pre existing VM's regardless of Provisioner

Ironic doesn't require these to be shutdown but leaving them running
leads to nodes running in CI from previous tests hitting the API of
services in the current test. The resulting errors and trace-backs
are confusing when debugging problems.

Change-Id: Ia5bccd69af0f92c14db901f09b32521821ba567d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/87/120887/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ensure any existing VM's in the test environment are shutdown, so devtest always starts at a consistent point. for NUM in $(seq 0 14) ; do ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o PasswordAuthentication=no ${VM_HOST} virsh destroy baremetalbrbm${ENV_NUM}_${NUM} || true done for NUM in $(seq 0 14) ; do virsh destroy baremetal_${NUM} || true done
deleted_lines: # nova-baremetal doesn't kill these, they need to be destroyed to avoid conflicting with new CI runs, # this can be removed when we're exclusively using ironic. if [ "${USE_IRONIC:-0}" = "0" ] ; then for NUM in $(seq 0 14) ; do ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o PasswordAuthentication=no ${VM_HOST} virsh destroy baremetalbrbm${ENV_NUM}_${NUM} || true done fi if [ "${USE_IRONIC:-0}" = "0" ] ; then for NUM in $(seq 0 14) ; do virsh destroy baremetal_${NUM} || true done fi

commit_message:
Make assertion in assert_ostf_run_certain more verbose

Right now if assert_ostf_run_certain fails, the output is
"AssertionError: Condition was False."
which does not help much. The change makes it more verbose
giving the details of tests which must have passed but failed.

Change-Id: Iab373c3d4809e6f27147f9331f80ba03f02ae801
(cherry picked from commit beac5f49350d99167a8c797e68d78bb63501a968)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/75/120575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fail_details = [] for set_result in set_result_list: for test in set_result['tests']: intresting_test = False for test_class in tests_must_be_passed: if test['id'].find(test_class) > -1: intresting_test = True if intresting_test: if test['status'] == 'success': else: details = ('%s (%s). Test status: %s, message: %s' % (test['name'], test['id'], test['status'], test['message'])) fail_details.append(details) assert_true(tests_pass_count == tests_count, 'The following tests have not succeeded, while they ' 'must have passed: %s' % fail_details)
deleted_lines: result = False for set_result in set_result_list: success = [test for test in set_result['tests'] if test['status'] == 'success'] for test_id in success: for test_class in tests_must_be_passed: if test_id['id'].find(test_class) > -1: if tests_pass_count == tests_count: result = True assert_true(result)

commit_message:
Remove extraneous created_iso property

The Redis driver's MessageEnvelope model has a created_iso property
that was only used in one place. This patch removes the property
and simply calls timeutils directly in the one place it is needed.

Change-Id: Icb7aab9d5e0c1e33684951bb5dc4182825f16465
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/56/120256/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: created_iso = timeutils.iso8601_from_timestamp(self.created) basic_msg['created'] = created_iso

commit_message:
Checking cluster status before actions

* add checking if cluster is operational or error state
  when calling an action to run OSTF tests through fuelclient
* add checking of cluster status when running network
  verification in nailgun

Change-Id: I3f40fb0e0b3d589834c242e73e9f8250daf4e05f
Closes-Bug: #1337887
Closes-Bug: #1337884

Add docs environment to tox.ini

As per the governance resolution https://review.openstack.org/119875,
projects should have a docs environment in their tox.ini testing
interface. Add one.

commit_message:
Pass instance to set_instance_error_state vs. uuid

Quick fix to patch one case in which instance.uuid was still being
passed to _set_instance_error_state when retries are disabled in
rescheduling cases.  Also updated the respective test case.

Change-Id: I24a682b926bc570d7e932ffedc664a95d41fda85
Closes-Bug: #1367342

commit_message:
Parametrizing the number of Swift replicas

Currently the number of Swift replicas is set to 1.  However most
deployments will use a replica count of 3.  We have added a
parameter SwiftReplicas with a default of 1 to allow a user to set
the replica count when creating an overcloud stack.

Change-Id: Ic676e44392786745818396dcc98cd9883a1ddd6d

commit_message:
Always revert to inital state in fake mode

* when nailgun runs in fake mode when node that belongs to cluster and
  is offline will not be completely remove when reset/delete action
* add new option `restore_offline_nodes` to `fake_tasks` decorator
  in tests to control this behavior
* fixed WebTest warning about body in DELETE request in tests from
  test_cluster_handler.py
* add test for new behavior

Change-Id: I9d400e1e8c385cd594c74d7f529e4e1fbe6d7843
Closes-Bug: #1335133

distributions.

commit_message:
Refactor ways of creating anonymous test user

Some Swift tests require random user creation to test ACL features or
prepare special data by reseller admin's requests, but that occurs
code duplication. Especially, assigning role id code was too lengthy.

This commit aggregates common codes and remove unused clean-up statements.

Change-Id: I4b965fceeec7c9cd1857375053e148d85f5f5bca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/75/116875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: os_test_user = clients.Manager(self.data.test_credentials)
deleted_lines: cls.data.teardown_all() os_test_user = clients.Manager( self.data.test_credentials) # Retrieve the id of an operator role of object storage test_role_id = None swift_role = CONF.object_storage.operator_role try: _, roles = self.os_admin.identity_client.list_roles() test_role_id = next(r['id'] for r in roles if r['name'] == swift_role) except StopIteration: msg = "%s role found" % swift_role raise exceptions.NotFound(msg) # Retrieve the test_user id _, users = self.os_admin.identity_client.get_users() test_user_id = next(usr['id'] for usr in users if usr['name'] == self.data.test_user) # Retrieve the test_tenant id _, tenants = self.os_admin.identity_client.list_tenants() test_tenant_id = next(tnt['id'] for tnt in tenants if tnt['name'] == self.data.test_tenant) # Assign the newly created user the appropriate operator role self.os_admin.identity_client.assign_user_role( test_tenant_id, test_user_id, test_role_id)

subject: Better timeout exception in wait_for_resource_deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-10 18:38:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/rest_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/3027674f5261fa8c29c43344775b95d0dc3e315e', 'message': "Better timeout exception in wait_for_resource_deletion

The generic rest_client.wait_for_resource_deletion
doesn't put anything into the TimeoutException that's
raised which makes it harder to debug failures.

This follows the pattern in the common waiters module

Change-Id: Ib0f30f15d5147aab63da35efec2f899e3ca31990
Related-Bug: #1367857
"}]
commit_message:
Better timeout exception in wait_for_resource_deletion

The generic rest_client.wait_for_resource_deletion
doesn't put anything into the TimeoutException that's
raised which makes it harder to debug failures.

This follows the pattern in the common waiters module
to put the test information and the resource id into
the TimeoutException message.

Change-Id: Ib0f30f15d5147aab63da35efec2f899e3ca31990
Related-Bug: #1367857
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/19/120519/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: message = ('Failed to delete resource %(id)s within the ' 'required time (%(timeout)s s).' % {'id': id, 'timeout': self.build_timeout}) caller = misc_utils.find_test_caller() if caller: message = '(%s) %s' % (caller, message) raise exceptions.TimeoutException(message)

commit_message:
Use only one configuration file

This patch merge all the configuration file for glance-api and
glance-registry in one configuration (which should be file generated by
oslo.config.generator) and one paste configuration file (with 2
different pipelines).

Change-Id: Ia5395038daf75a7b798f85727e280fbb50deccc7

commit_message:
tests: import option before overriding it

This allow to execute test only from this file, without relying on the
side effect of other part of the code that might be loaded and therefore
define the option.

Change-Id: Id229f6fddeb49cc938bc2ae4a7c839ddf3d8633d

commit_message:
Make the extension docs a top level entry in the landing page

Currently any documentation about extensions that Keystone offers
is lacking at best. This patch moves the documentation out of the
busy configuration section, and to index/landing page.

It also provides a brief summary for each extension, and a logical
point of entry for additional information.

Change-Id: Ide8ac9b277e0fc9cab9c01073bb72fe3bc369aed

commit_message:
Add missing gettextutils _ function import

All these modules are not importable on their own because they don't
import the _ function theirself. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: If04a53ede37932ebf812bbef8ce1f93b73a75f34
