'}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2014-09-08 05:24:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/883623f9ce4459c3ffbae7030ce13e360fd992d6', 'message': 'VMware: spawn refactor image fetch/cache

To more cleanly support the various permutations of the following during
spawn():
- different types image to spawn with (sparse, flat, iso,
  and streamOptimized, ova in the futre)
- different ways to obtain the image (http download, and direct
  datastore copy in the future)
- different ways to prepare the downloaded image bits into a usable
  image in the image cache (replace -flat.vmdk extent, convert from
  sparse, pick from imported VM, ...)

The following are introduced:
- Image prepare/fetch/cache functions : these are callbacks for
  processing the bits into a usable form to be cached in the image cache
  under various scenarios.
- Image fetching functions : these are callbacks called by the processor
  to obtain the bits for the hypervisor.

All unit tests should pass unmodified after this refactor.

This should will allow for more self-contained additions/changes
to behaviors in these areas in the future.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

commit_message:
VMware: spawn refactor image fetch/cache

To more cleanly support the various permutations of the following during
spawn():
- different types image to spawn with (sparse, flat, iso,
  and streamOptimized, ova in the futre)
- different ways to obtain the image (http download, and direct
  datastore copy in the future)
- different ways to prepare the downloaded image bits into a usable
  image in the image cache (replace -flat.vmdk extent, convert from
  sparse, pick from imported VM, ...)

The following are introduced:
- Image prepare/fetch/cache functions : these are callbacks for
  processing the bits into a usable form to be cached in the image cache
  under various scenarios.
- Image fetching functions : these are callbacks called by the processor
  to obtain the bits for the hypervisor.

All unit tests should pass unmodified after this refactor.

This should will allow for more self-contained additions/changes
to behaviors in these areas in the future.

Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>
partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor
Change-Id: I8fb46b5a3ef4bb89a6084df955d82821216ebb40

commit_message:
Initial congressclient

This patch adds client support for congress with keystone and supports
the following api commands:

	$ openstack congress policy list
	$ openstack congress policy row get
	$ openstack congress policy rule create
	$ openstack congress policy rule delete
	$ openstack congress policy rules list

Change-Id: I624b54f6cf2614eaec970c8bdd3766291dcc9489
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-congressclient refs/changes/75/104375/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functools from congressclient import exceptions class SessionClient(object): def __init__(self, session, auth, interface, service_type, region_name): self.session = session self.auth = auth self.interface = interface self.service_type = service_type self.region_name = region_name def request(self, url, method, **kwargs): kwargs.setdefault('user_agent', 'python-congressclient') kwargs.setdefault('auth', self.auth) kwargs.setdefault('authenticated', False) try: kwargs['json'] = kwargs.pop('body') except KeyError: pass headers = kwargs.setdefault('headers', {}) headers.setdefault('Accept', 'application/json') endpoint_filter = kwargs.setdefault('endpoint_filter', {}) endpoint_filter.setdefault('interface', self.interface) endpoint_filter.setdefault('service_type', self.service_type) endpoint_filter.setdefault('region_name', self.region_name) resp = self.session.request(url, method, raise_exc=False, **kwargs) body = None if resp.text: try: body = resp.json() except ValueError: pass if resp.status_code >= 400: raise exceptions.from_response(resp, body, url, method) return resp, body def _cs_request(self, url, method, **kwargs): # this function is mostly redundant but makes compatibility easier kwargs.setdefault('authenticated', True) return self.request(url, method, **kwargs) def get(self, url, **kwargs): return self._cs_request(url, 'GET', **kwargs) def post(self, url, **kwargs): return self._cs_request(url, 'POST', **kwargs) def put(self, url, **kwargs): return self._cs_request(url, 'PUT', **kwargs) def delete(self, url, **kwargs): return self._cs_request(url, 'DELETE', **kwargs)

commit_message:
Fix security group list when not defined for an instance

If an instance has an empty security group list an exception
is thrown due to iteration attempt of None.

To fix this, this patch modifies get_instance_security_group
to return an empty list instead of None.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_neutron_security_groups.py
	nova/tests/network/security_group/test_neutron_driver.py

Change-Id: I7efb3c3a58d7e20501d126c6d194479ca1d14166
Closes-Bug: #1291489
(cherry picked from commit c32986966dfd034c3d706b2e9ab2820a2c3cfc3e)

commit_message:
Make osprofiler library optional for services

This makes it possible to run Cinder w/o osprofiler
installed.  Note that you may need to remove it from
your api-paste configuration as well.

It remains in requirements.txt since the default
api-paste configuration does use it.

Closes-Bug: #1361239

Change-Id: I46199f6e951c02a80e9cc763de364dbbd800b10d

commit_message:
Added test cases for CollectionHandler

Change-Id: Ic549648ef9a187457269cff3309ab997b1d1ad18
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/35/115235/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import httplib import jsonfrom mock import MagicMock def test_create_member(self): collection_handler = webservice.CollectionHandler(r'/', '') collection_handler.model = webservice.SimpleDataModel("test") request = MagicMock() request.body = '{"key": "value"}' request.path = "/" response = collection_handler.create_member(request, id_='123') self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) self.assertEqual(str(httplib.CREATED) + " Created", response.status) self.assertEqual("%s/%s" % (request.path, '123'), response.location) def test_list_members(self): collection_handler = webservice.CollectionHandler(r'/', '') collection_handler.model = webservice.SimpleDataModel("test") request = MagicMock() request.body = '{"key": "value"}' request.params = MagicMock() request.path = "/" response = collection_handler.list_members(request) items = collection_handler.model.get_items( request.params, context=collection_handler._get_context(request)) expected_body = "%s\n" % json.dumps(items, indent=2) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) self.assertEqual(expected_body, response.body)

commit_message:
Add example update

Change-Id: I9df557d2f95d08b161e3143106fa826fcd599c47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/37/116737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Example Update Command For example: python -m examples.update openstack/network/v2_0/network.py \ --data '{"name": "foo"}' """ import sys from examples import common from examples import session def run_update(opts): sess = session.make_session(opts) cls = common.find_resource_cls(opts) obj = cls.new(**common.get_data_option(opts)) obj.update(sess) print(str(obj)) return if __name__ == "__main__": opts = common.setup() sys.exit(common.main(opts, run_update))

commit_message:
Log ERROR power state in node_power_action()

Power driver can returns ERROR state. Log this error and do not
break requested action (this can be unknown valid state).

Partial-Bug: #1358816
Change-Id: I9b26440671cb44b58016dfd796adbd8fedd483ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/99/117499/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils import _LW if curr_state == states.ERROR: # be optimistic and continue action LOG.warn(_LW("Driver returns ERROR power state for node %(node)s.") % {'node': node.uuid})

subject: Translator functions cleanup part 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-03 10:08:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/0715306cecb890a6e55a1e02d2b7cad40b8ed8ea', 'message': 'Translator functions cleanup part 3

This part fixes ironic/conductor, ironic/dhcp and ironic/objects
folders.

Some modules use _ function for log translation, even when the
translated string is passed to e.g. LOG.warn function. This patch
fixes it, using translator functions appropriate for corresponding
log levels. Translator functions, imported from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils are now imported from
ironic.common.i18n. Translator functions are imported the same way
across all modules.

Partial-bug: #1364813

Change-Id: Ib4b93cc49f16836a95c7cfb4c5f1705f5cbbb31f
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-03 12:42:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/23b73d2532ed409d52b24ce67f09c9dcd319561e', 'message': 'Translator functions cleanup part 3

This part fixes ironic/conductor, ironic/dhcp and ironic/objects
folders.

Some modules use _ function for log translation, even when the
translated string is passed to e.g. LOG.warn function. This patch
fixes it, using translator functions appropriate for corresponding
log levels. Translator functions, imported from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils are now imported from
ironic.common.i18n. Translator functions are imported the same way
across all modules. All places that are changed conform to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

fixes it, using translator functions appropriate for corresponding
log levels. Translator functions, imported from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils are now imported from
ironic.common.i18n. Translator functions are imported the same way
across all modules. All places that are changed conform to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Partial-bug: #1364813

Change-Id: Ib4b93cc49f16836a95c7cfb4c5f1705f5cbbb31f
'}]
commit_message:
Translator functions cleanup part 3

This part fixes ironic/conductor, ironic/dhcp and ironic/objects
folders.

Some modules use _ function for log translation, even when the
translated string is passed to e.g. LOG.warn function. This patch
fixes it, using translator functions appropriate for corresponding
log levels. Translator functions, imported from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils are now imported from
ironic.common.i18n. Translator functions are imported the same way
across all modules. All places that are changed conform to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Partial-bug: #1364813

Change-Id: Ib4b93cc49f16836a95c7cfb4c5f1705f5cbbb31f

commit_message:
Make assertion in assert_ostf_run_certain more verbose

Right now if assert_ostf_run_certain fails, the output is
"AssertionError: Condition was False."
which does not help much. The change makes it more verbose
giving the details of tests which must have passed but failed.

Change-Id: Iab373c3d4809e6f27147f9331f80ba03f02ae801

commit_message:
Install the correct arping package for neutron

Debian requires the iputils-arping package (not arping)
for the neutron L3 agent.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I2b127a247852fd5c6b9b2d270ba13f012386fe31
Closes-Bug: #1352558
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/33/111833/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install-packages iputils-arping

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testtools from openstack.identity.v3 import project IDENTIFIER = 'IDENTIFIER' EXAMPLE = { 'description': '1', 'domain_id': '2', 'enabled': True, 'id': IDENTIFIER, 'name': '5', } class TestProject(testtools.TestCase): def test_basic(self): sot = project.Project() self.assertEqual('project', sot.resource_key) self.assertEqual('projects', sot.resources_key) self.assertEqual('/projects', sot.base_path) self.assertEqual('identity', sot.service.service_type) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_create) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_retrieve) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_update) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_delete) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_list) def test_make_it(self): sot = project.Project(EXAMPLE) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['description'], sot.description) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['domain_id'], sot.domain_id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['enabled'], sot.enabled) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['id'], sot.id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['name'], sot.name)
